Programme planning is defined as
options:
A method to determine how far an activity has been progressed and how
much further it should be carried out to accomplish the objectives

A decision making process involving critical analysis of the existing situation
and problems, evaluation of various alternatives to solve these problems and
selection of relevant ones for individual and community development

Changing the behavior of local rural people for implementing the skillful
information in their own farming system

Process by which an individual can decide on what to do, how to do and
with what result prior to implementation
correctAnswer:
A decision making process involving critical analysis of the existing situation
and problems, evaluation of various alternatives to solve these problems and
selection of relevant ones for individual and community development

question: Choose the correct statement about 'extension education':
options: Strict adherence to institutional norms and no free choice for the learners
The learners are homogenous with common goals

Education starts with practical situation of the learners in which they live
and work and develops into theoretical or basic understanding of them

There is a fixed curriculum, after completion of which the students are
examined and degrees are awarded
correctAnswer:
Education starts with practical situation of the learners in which they live
and work and develops into theoretical or basic understanding of them

question:
The programme/project aimed at disseminating the proven technology
in a discipline/area among farmers on a watershed basis, covering the whole village
and concurrently studying the constraints as barriers to the rapid spread of
technical know - how?

Choose the wrong statement about the provisions of "Seventy-Third
Amendment Act 1992 of The Constitution".
options:
Panchayats shall be constituted in every State at the village, intermediate
and district levels
All the seats in the Panchayat shall be filled by direct election

All the blocks should have Agriculture Technology Management Agency to
co-ordinate agriculture and allied activities

Seats should be reserved for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in
every Panchayat
correctAnswer:
All the blocks should have Agriculture Technology Management Agency to
co-ordinate agriculture and allied activities

question: Intensive Agricultural Area Programme has the objectives
options:
To extend the benefits of improved technology in larger areas at less cost
with reduced staff strength to promote intensive agriculture

High yielding wheat varieties developed in Mexico were imported for
experimentation and adaptation to Indian conditions
To run vocational training centres on co-operative lines

To identify eligible farmers, agricultural labourers and their problems,
devising economic programmes for gainful employment and augmenting income
correctAnswer:
To extend the benefits of improved technology in larger areas at less cost
with reduced staff strength to promote intensive agriculture

question: Which is not the characteristic of a successful entrepreneur?
options: Have a positive approach towards things, they become optimistic for future

They do not like to be guided by others and to follow their rules, they like to
be independent

Willingness to work under a manager so that risks involved in the success of
enterprise is not affected

Initiate research and innovative activities to produce goods to satisfy the
customers changing requirements
correctAnswer:
Willingness to work under a manager so that risks involved in the success of
enterprise is not affected

question: Fabian entrepreneur is
options:
Characterized by refusal to adopt opportunities to make changes in
production formulae at the cost of severely reduced returns relative to other like
producers

One who introduce new goods, inaugurate new method of production,
discover new market and recognize the enterprise

Characterized by readiness to adopt successful innovation inaugurated by
innovating entrepreneurs

Characterized by very great caution and skepticism in experimenting any
change in their enterprise, they imitate only when it becomes perfect
correctAnswer:
Characterized by very great caution and skepticism in experimenting any
change in their enterprise, they imitate only when it becomes perfect

question: The salient feature of 'Systems approach' in Transfer of Technology
options:
There is no interaction between research and officials/extension agents who
are actually involved in technology transfer

It is an extension/communication system to evolve technology, transfer
technology from research station to farmer's fields, adopts technology and takes
benefits from it
The role of extension was to persuade farmers to adopt new technologies

Farmers were seen as passive recipient of technologies as there is no
provision for feedback
correctAnswer:
It is an extension/communication system to evolve technology, transfer
technology from research station to farmer's fields, adopts technology and takes
benefits from it

question:
A scientific method for identification of leaders which is concerned with
obtaining choices on interpersonal relations such as with whom one would like to
work, play etc. or to whom one would go for advice or for dealing other problems

An extension teaching method which is coming under group contact
method and is used to show the technique of doing things to impart skill or carrying
out new practices
